summary: Scopolamine, also called hyoscine or Devil's Breath, is a medicine made from a plant called nightshade. It helps with motion sickness and nausea after surgery. It works by blocking a brain chemical called acetylcholine. Scopolamine has been used since 1900 for anesthesia. In large doses, it can cause hallucinations, which some people use for recreational purposes. It's important to use it only as directed by a doctor. The World Health Organization considers it an essential medicine.
title: Scopolamine
